column4: is there a way I can blacklist modules from loading in Ubuntu? if so how?
If you dont tell them to load, the wont.
it detected my onboard sound chip, I'll never use it
module snd_ice1724, but I don't know wich file Ubuntu is using for it's modules, modprobe or modules
same with the onboard silicone image driver
disabled in bios but still loaded
if it's disabled in bios then the module wont load because it ownt find the hardware
yeah, the snd_ice1724 is my onboard sound, I have an Audigy2zs I normally use
Anyway, you've surpassed my knowledge, sorry :D
my Silicone Image sata controller is disabled and so is my onboard sound chip though, and my serial ports and printer ports and Ubuntu still picked them up lol
